<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Countercharm](/Feats.aspx?ID=3361) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 121</row>

**Archetype** [Captivator](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=125)

**Prerequisites**
[Basic Captivator Spellcasting](/Feats.aspx?ID=3359)

**Trigger**
A creature Casts a Spell from the [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61) or [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) school.

**Requirements**
You have an innate non-cantrip captivator spell of the same school.

</column>

---

Your enchantments and illusions are so dominant that you can use them to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) similar magic cast by others. When a foe casts an enchantment or illusion spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own innate magic to disrupt it. You lose an innate, non-cantrip spell of the same school as the triggering spell as if you had Cast the Spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell with your spell.
name: Countercharm
requirement: You have an innate non-cantrip captivator spell of the same school.
requirement_markdown: You have an innate non-cantrip captivator spell of the same school.
